channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Warren Buffett could finally address Trump’s tariffs at Berkshire Hathaway’s annual meeting. Here’s how to watch for free – and without cable.
item.description: The Oracle of Omaha breaks his silence.

item.title: Japan’s historic work ethic is declining—45% of workers admit they’re quiet quitting
item.description: Workers said they do the basics required for their jobs for various reasons, but cite wanting a better work-life balance.

item.title: Ruth Buzzi, Purse-Wielding Gladys of ‘Laugh-In,’ Is Dead at 88
item.description: She had other roles onstage and on TV, but none more memorable than the wary spinster fending off male advances on that raucous sketch show.

item.title: Explosions Cripple Ship Carrying Aid to Gaza in the Mediterranean Sea
item.description: A human rights group operating the ship blamed a drone attack for the explosions, which caused a fire on the vessel. The crew was safe and remained on...

item.title: How Rubio Proved Himself as Trump’s Loyal Foreign Policy Foot Soldier
item.description: As Secretary of State, Marco Rubio has been Donald Trump’s reliable echo on issues like Iran, Ukraine and Gaza. But Steve Witkoff, the president’s fri...

item.title: PPG CEO says company is ready to navigate Trump tariff uncertainty: ‘Our top 30 suppliers for our U.S. businesses, 0 of them are Chinese’
item.description: PPG reported net sales of $3.68 billion for the quarter, a 4% decline from the year prior, impacted by foreign exchange rates and recent divestitures.

item.title: Israel Launches Airstrikes Near Syrian Presidential Palace
item.description: It was the second time in days that Israel intervened militarily in Syria amid a wave of sectarian violence there.

item.title: Toy shortages are in the pipeline as U.S. firms cancel orders with tariffs putting Christmas ‘at risk’
item.description: According to a recent survey from the Toy Association, 80% of mid-sized companies and 64% of small companies are canceling orders.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto VI, the expected biggest gaming event of the year, is delayed until May 2026
item.description: Shares of publisher Take-Two Interactive Software take a dive.

item.title: Universal Antivenom May Grow Out of Man Who Let Snakes Bite Him Hundreds of Times
item.description: Scientists identified antibodies that neutralized the poison in whole or in part from the bites of cobras, mambas and other deadly species.

item.title: Maps: 7.4-Magnitude Earthquake Near Chile Prompts Tsunami Alert
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Explosions Cripple Ship Carrying Aid to Gaza in the Mediterranean Sea
item.description: A human rights group operating the ship blamed a drone attack for the explosions, which caused a fire on the vessel. The crew was safe and remained on...

item.title: How Rubio Proved Himself as Trump’s Loyal Foreign Policy Foot Soldier
item.description: As Secretary of State, Marco Rubio has been Donald Trump’s reliable echo on issues like Iran, Ukraine and Gaza. But Steve Witkoff, the president’s fri...

item.title: Universal Antivenom May Grow Out of Man Who Let Snakes Bite Him Hundreds of Times
item.description: Scientists identified antibodies that neutralized the poison in whole or in part from the bites of cobras, mambas and other deadly species.
